people.aboutText: Antoine Ashley (born December 17, 1984 – October 1, 2012), better known by his stage name Sahara Davenport, was an American drag queen, singer, reality television personality, and classically trained dancer. He was best known as a contestant on the second season of RuPaul's Drag Race.

people.name: Ryuichi Ogata
people.aboutText: Chelsea Elizabeth Manning (born Bradley Edward Manning, December 17, 1987) is a United States Army soldier who was convicted in July 2013 of violations of the Espionage Act and other offenses, after disclosing to WikiLeaks nearly three-quarters of a million classified or unclassified but sensitive military and diplomatic documents. Manning was sentenced in August 2013 to 35 years' imprisonment, with the possibility of parole in the eighth year, and to be dishonorably discharged from the Army. Manning is a trans woman who, in a statement the day after sentencing, said she had felt female since childhood, wanted to be known as Chelsea, and desired to begin hormone replacement therapy.

people.name: Craig Reid
people.aboutText: Luis Maria Alfageme (born 17 December 1984) is an Argentine footballer who plays for Casertana at Italian Lega Pro.

people.name: Emma Bell
people.aboutText: Jeremy Wade McKinnon (born December 17, 1985) is a founding member and the lead vocalist of A Day to Remember.

people.name: Vanessa Zima
people.aboutText: Bo Kuangyi(born 17 December 1987), more commonly known as Bo Guagua, is the second son of former Chinese politician Bo Xilai, and the only child of Gu Kailai, his father's second wife. Bo attended Harrow School, read PPE at Oxford University, and studied for a master's degree at Harvard University. He is currently enrolled in the JD program at Columbia Law School.

people.name: Bo Guagua
people.aboutText: Mikky Ekko (born John Stephen Sudduth; December 17, 1984) is an American artist and record producer from Louisiana, signed to RCA Records. He is best known for being featured on Rihanna's 2013 single "Stay", which has charted in multiple countries worldwide, becoming Ekko's first-charting material.

people.name: Chelsea Manning
people.aboutText:
Onur Özsu (born on 17 December 1982; Izmir, Turkey) Pop music artist, singer, songwriter, musician, performer.
Pop Music Artist Onur Ozsu who is from Izmir/Turkiye has the aim of producing independent, brave and innovative music work in a wide range and also producing specific musical work apart from using the local and universal tones of music. He also attracts attention by his keyboard and vocal performances.

people.name: Liisa Ehrberg
people.aboutText:
Ashley Louise Edner (born December 17, 1990) is an American actress.
Edner was born in Downey, California, the daughter of Cindy and Bob Edner, and the younger sister of actor Bobby Edner. Her credits include Angel, Malcolm in the Middle, MAD TV, The Amanda Show, Martial Law, Party of Five, The X Files, Star Trek: Voyager, Will & Grace, Listen Up!, and The Twilight Zone, (episode: "The Collection").

people.name: Grethe Grünberg
people.aboutText: Grethe Grünberg (born 17 December 1988) is an Estonian retired ice dancer.

people.name: Kris Joseph
people.aboutText: Nathaniel Marvin "Nat" Wolff (born December 17, 1994) is an American actor, singer-songwriter, composer, keyboardist, and guitarist. Wolff gained recognition for starring in and composing the music for the Nickelodeon musical comedy series The Naked Brothers Band (2007–09) which was created and produced by his actress mother Polly Draper. Wolff's jazz pianist father, Michael Wolff, co-produced the series' two soundtrack albums, the self-titled album The Naked Brothers Band (2007) which ranked #23 on the Billboard 200, and the follow-up I Don't Want to Go to School (2008).

people.name: David Rudisha
people.aboutText: James, Viscount Severn (James Alexander Philip Theo Mountbatten-Windsor; born 17 December 2007), is the younger child and only son of the Earl and Countess of Wessex, and the youngest grandchild of Queen Elizabeth II and the Duke of Edinburgh.

people.name: Craig Sutherland
people.aboutText: David Lekuta Rudisha, MBS (born 17 December 1988) is a Kenyan middle-distance runner. He is the current Olympic champion and world record holder in the 800 metres. Rudisha was the first person to run under 1:41 for the event, and he holds the three fastest, six of the eight fastest, and half of the twenty fastest times ever run in this event.

people.name: Rin Takanashi
people.aboutText: Kristopher Joseph (born December 17, 1988) is a Canadian professional basketball player who plays for Orléans Loiret Basket of the LNB Pro A. He played for the Syracuse Orange men's basketball team from 2008 to 2012.

people.name: Henri Anier
people.aboutText: Rin Takanashi (高梨 臨, Takanashi Rin, born December 17, 1988) is a Japanese actress.

people.name: Ashley Edner
people.aboutText:
Makoto Takeda (竹田真恋人, Takeda Makoto, born December 17, 1990) is a Japanese actress and model signed to Stardust Promotion. She is well known for portraying Yuki in Cutie Honey: The Live.
^ "http://www.stardust.co.jp/profile/takedamakoto.html".

people.name: Makoto Takeda
people.aboutText: James Hurst (born December 17, 1991) is an American football offensive tackle for the Baltimore Ravens of the National Football League (NFL). He was signed by the Ravens as an undrafted free agent in 2014.

people.name: James Hurst
people.aboutText: Henri Anier (born 17 December 1990) is an Estonian professional footballer who plays as a striker for Scottish club Hibernian on loan from Scottish Premiership club Dundee United and the Estonia national football team.

people.name: Nadech Kugimiya
people.aboutText: Craig Stephen Sutherland (born 17 December 1988) is a Scottish footballer who plays as a forward for East Fife. He began his career in the United States playing college soccer for Midwestern State University and North Carolina State University. Sutherland played 16 times in the Football League for Blackpool and Plymouth Argyle between 2011 and 2012.

people.name: Atsedu Tsegay
people.aboutText: Nadech Kugimiya (Thai: ณเดชน์ คูกิมิยะ; rtgs: Nadet Khukimiya, born December 17, 1991 in Thailand) is a Thai model and actor. Nadech Kugimiya is the youngest adopted child of Yoshio Kugimiya (his adoptive father) and Sudarat Kugimiya (his adoptive mother). Nadech Kugimiya was born in Khonkaen, Thailand.

people.name: Patricia Kú Flores
people.aboutText:
Patricia Iveth Kú Flores (born 17 December 1993) is a Peruvian tennis player.
Kú Flores has won four singles and four doubles titles on the ITF tour in her career. On 1 April 2013, she reached her best singles ranking of world number 327.

people.name: Kiersey Clemons
people.aboutText: Kiersey Nicole Clemons (born December 17, 1993) is an American actress and singer. Clemons is best known for her role as Diggy in the award-winning film Dope, and as Bianca on the TV series Transparent. She also played Lucy on the Steven Spielberg CBS series Extant.

people.name: Nat Wolff
people.aboutText:
Atsedu Tsegay Tesfay (born 17 December 1991) is an Ethiopian long-distance runner. In 2012, he won Prague Half Marathon in a time of 58:47 — the best half marathon performance of the year and an Ethiopian record.
His first major international appearance was at the 2010 World Junior Championships in Athletics, where he placed sixth in the 5000 metres final.

people.name: Naiktha Bains
people.aboutText:
Naiktha Bains (born 17 December 1997 in Leeds, United Kingdom) is an Australian tennis player.
On 13 October 2014, Bains reached her best singles ranking of world number 651. On 4 May 2015, she peaked at world number 547 in the doubles rankings.

people.name: Martin Ødegaard
people.aboutText:
Martin Ødegaard (born 17 December 1998) is a Norwegian professional footballer who plays as an attacking midfielder for Spanish club Real Madrid Castilla and the Norway national team.
He made his debut for Strømsgodset Toppfotball on 13 April 2014, becoming the youngest player to feature in Tippeligaen, and became its youngest goalscorer on 16 May. After being a regular part of the team in his first season and training with several foreign clubs, Ødegaard was signed by Real Madrid in January 2015.

people.name: James, Viscount Severn
people.aboutText:
Liisa Ehrberg (born 17 December 1988) is an Estonian racing cyclist. She rode at the 2014 UCI Road World Championships.
^ "Liisa Ehrberg".
